intro: Warneckea madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar warneckea, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, tubular flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant features woody stems and lance-shaped leaves with a smooth texture. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded forest environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
